scenarioDescription:
The FU Tau Exoplanetary System


Overview

FU Tau is a star with 0.05 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.001 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

FU Tau is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the FU Tau system


FU Tau b

FU Tau b was discovered by the Spitzer Space Telescope observatory, in 2009-02, using the imaging method. Its semi-major axis is 800.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of FU Tau b is 5088.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of FU Tau b is 12.200 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, FU Tau b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system FU Tau, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Spitzer Space Telescope.
name: FU Tau - System With 1 Exoplanet
